**Discharge Letter:**

Patient Name: Samantha Evans  
Age: 55  
Date of Admission: September 5, 2024  
Date of Discharge: 09-13-2024  

Dear Dr. Johnson,

I am writing to inform you of the discharge of Ms. Samantha Evans, a 55-year-old female who was admitted to our hospital on September 5, 2024. Ms. Evans presented with complaints of acute abdominal pain, fever, and vomiting.

During her hospitalization, Ms. Evans underwent a series of diagnostic tests, including abdominal ultrasound, CT scan, and blood work. The results revealed evidence of acute appendicitis, necessitating urgent surgical intervention.

On September 6, 2024, Ms. Evans underwent an uncomplicated laparoscopic appendectomy, during which the inflamed appendix was successfully removed. She tolerated the procedure well and showed signs of clinical improvement postoperatively.

Throughout her hospital stay, Ms. Evans received intravenous antibiotics, analgesics, and supportive care to facilitate her recovery. She was closely monitored for signs of surgical site infection and postoperative complications.

After eight days of hospitalization, Ms. Evans's condition improved significantly, and she was discharged home on September 13, 2024. She was provided with a prescription for oral antibiotics to complete her course of treatment and instructions for wound care.

We anticipate a smooth recovery for Ms. Evans and recommend close outpatient follow-up to monitor her progress.

Sincerely,

[Physician's Signature]  
Dr. Emily Johnson  
General Surgeon
